Work History

    Software Developer Intern

    (June 2015 - August 2015) | Santa Monica, CA

    Worked on the payments team to develop a generalized anomaly detection service. The service easily allowed the user to add queries to be monitored. Worked with Echo State Networks along with a few other algorithms. Worked with the payments code base to filter out all sensitive information from the logs.

    Tools Used: Python, Javascript, Scala, Mongo, D3

    (Sep. 2014 - Dec. 2014) | Cal Poly - San Luis Obispo

    Intruct and guide students weekly by paralleling the Phyiscs curriculum. Includes preparing worksheets and problems that actively challenge students.

Projects

  • 2015

    dtour

    Road trip planner | link

    Uses the Google Maps Directions API as well as the Yelp API to help plan places to stop at on a road trip. The app calculates where the driver will be at meal times and suggests highly rated restaurants in that area. Built using Node.js.

  • 2015

    Automated Device Interaction

    IR Sensor

    Worked on a web service to send IR commands to a raspberry pi which then were transmitted to a living room device. A backend handled the tasks and task history while the raspberry pi hosted its own endpoint that converted commands to IR signals. Both endpoints were written in python using flask.

  • 2015

    Poker Bot

    Highly Optimized Gambling | link

    Created a poker game that would allow for users to connect poker bots and play poker. Componnts included managing various gamestates, win conditions and game flow. The backend was written in python using flask.
